articles.author: ABC News
articles.title: Dutch government orders three-week partial lockdown amid COVID surge - ABC News
articles.description: The lockdown is the first to start in western Europe since a new wave of infections began surging across parts of the continent.
articles.content: Caretaker Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte has announced a three-week partial lockdown amid surging COVID-19 cases in the Netherlands, saying his government wants to "deliver a hard blow to the virus"… [+4554 chars]

articles.title: Cold, hungry, afraid: The Middle East migrants stuck on EU's doorstep - Stuff.co.nz
articles.description: Trapped between Polish and Belarusian troops facing off on opposite sides of the European Union border, the migrants are suffering and terrified.
articles.content:
Sarkawt Ismat was cold, hungry and terrified, trapped between Polish and Belarusian troops facing off on opposite sides of the European Unions eastern border.

articles.author: Diane Taylor
articles.title: Brexit has made it easier for small boat crossings to reach UK, refugees say - The Guardian
articles.description: Outside EU, people can no longer be returned to other European countries under legislation known as Dublin regulation
articles.content:
Refugees living in northern France say Brexit has made it easier for them to reach the UK in small boats, as it emerged that record numbers of people crossed the Channel in one day.
